text: Papabile (/pəˈpɑːbɪleɪ/ pə-PAH-bil-ay, UK also /-li/ -⁠ee, Italian: [paˈpaːbile]; pl. papabili; lit. 'pop(e)able' or 'able to be pope') is an unofficial Italian term coined by Vaticanologists and used internationally in many languages to describe a Catholic man, in practice always a cardinal, who is thought of as a likely or possible candidate to be elected pope. \
title: Papabile
